A division of
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
PHONE: 667-6000 • 1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE • WASHINGTON, D.C. 20036
April 7, 1967
To: ETS Station Managers
From: Chalmers H. Marquis
He: Unofficial Schedule of Witnesses at Senate Subcommittee Hearings
on Public Television, April 11~14; 1967.
Tuesday,
April 11:
HEW Secretary John W, Gardner; FCC Chairman
Rosel H„ Hyde; Governor, Virgin Islands, Ralph
Paiewonsky, Roger L, Stevens, Chairman, National
Endowment for the Arts
Wednesday,
April 12:
From the Carnegie Commission on Educational Television:
Dr. James R. Killian, Jr., Chairman; Mrs. Oveta Culp
Hobby, Leonard Woodcock, and Edwin H. Land.
From the Ford Foundation: McGeorge Bundy, President;
Fred Friendly.
John Kiermaier (WNDT-New York), EEN President
Thursday,
April 13:
From NET: Everett Case, Board Chairman; John F.
V/hite, President.
E. William Henry, former FCC Chairman, NAEB Public
Director; Edwin G, Burrows, NAEB Board Chairman.
For ETS: Jack G. McBride, ETS Board Chairman;. Newton
Minow, Board Member, WTTW;WXXW, Chicago and NET,
FCC Chairman when ETV Facilities Act was passed;
Devereux Josephs, Board Member, WNDT; C. Scott Fletcher
ETS Executive Consultant, NAEB Public Director.
Friday,
April 14:
George Bair, NAEB Instructional Division Board Chairman
For NER: Jerrold Sandler, NER Executive Director;
Leslie Paffrath, President, The Johnson Foundation;
Dr. Fred Harrington, NAEB Public Director; Willard
Shadel, University of Washington; Dr. Robert Lewis
Shayon, University of Pennsylvania; and Dr. Frank M.
Woolsey, Jr., M. D, , Albany State Medical College .
